info.name: Mental Contrasting & Implementation Intentions
info.description:
Mental contrasting helps you visualize the positive effects of achieving a goal, orienting your brain towards the positive results of successful goal completion and helping you recognize what might stand in your way. 

Implementation intentions help you identify the key moments where action matters most so that you can create a plan for those situations. 

Combined, these processes naturally orient your brain towards the completion of a goal and help you develop a concrete course of action to take in order to achieve your goal!
info.research:
Mental contrasting is a technique by which you may imagine your goal as well as the main obstacle that may hinder you from achieving it. This will help you visualize both what you want as well as what may stand in your way, naturally orienting you towards the completion of your goal.

Implementation intentions address your need for action, helping you create an if-then plan to respond to a critical event signalling your obstacle. That way, when the time comes to act, you have the best response already prepared.

For further information see the following research:

Peter M. Gollwitzer, Doris Mayer, Christine Frick, Gabriele Oettingen. “Promoting the Self-Regulation of Stress in Health Care Providers: An Internet-Based Intervention”. Frontiers in Psychology, vol. 9, article 838, pp. 1-11, 2018.

Maik Bieleke, Lucas Keller, Peter M. Gollwitzer. “If-then planning”. European Review of Social Psychology, vol. 32, num. 1, pp. 88-122, 2021.

components.name: Find a Quiet Place
components.text: In order to focus fully on the task at hand, find a quiet place where your attention won't be pulled away from the task at hand. If you can't find a quiet place, just do your best to eliminate distractions. Throw on some headphones with gentle music, for instance, and sit where visual distractions will be at a minimum.

components.name: Goal Name
components.text:
What actually is it your goal to do? Add a concise title fitting the phrase below. 

My goal is to...

components.name: Best Possible Outcome
components.text:
You said your goal was to {Goal Name}. 

In one to two sentences, what is the best possible outcome that could come from achieving this? 

The best possible outcome of achieving my goal would be...

components.name: Vividly Imagine the Best Possible Outcome
components.text:
You said that the best possible outcome would be {Best Possible Outcome}. 

Take as much time as you need to thoroughly imagine the events and experiences that would be associated with this outcome. Picture every detail that you can think of to help your brain associate this with the completion of your goal. 

This is an important part of the process, so don't skip this!

components.name: Write About the Best Possible Outcome
components.text: Write down everything you visualized. The more you describe the thoughts and images you imagined, the more effective this process will be. Try to describe at least three or more thoughts or images you had while visualizing the best possible outcome.

components.name: Identify the Main Obstacle
components.text:
You said your goal was to {Goal Name}.

In one to two sentences, what is the single biggest obstacle that might prevent you from completing your goal?

The main obstacle to completing my goal is...

components.name: Vividly Imagine the Main Obstacle
components.text:
You said that your main obstacle would be {Identify the Main Obstacle}. 

Again, take as much time as you need to thoroughly imagine the events and experiences that might be associated with this obstacle. Vividly picture every detail that you can think of to help your brain accept this as an obstacle to completing your goal.

Remember, this is an important part of the process. Don't skip it!

components.name: Write About the Main Obstacle
components.text: Write down everything you visualized. Again, the more you describe the thoughts and images you imagined, the more effective this process will be. Once again, try to describe at least three or more thoughts or images you had while visualizing the main obstacle:

components.name: Taking Action
components.text:
Congrats! You've identified your goal and the largest obstacle that might keep you from achieving it.

You will now create a plan to defeat your greatest obstacle. This is known as an implementation intention, or more simply, an if-then plan. 

Basically, this takes the form of "if X occurs, I will Y".

components.name: Identify an Action
components.text:
You've already identified your main obstacle as {Identify the Main Obstacle}. But, what action might you take to overcome that obstacle?

Take some time to really think about this. What possible action best fits the obstacle you've identified? What response will most increase the likelihood of achieving your goal?

components.name: Choose an Action
components.text: The action I can take to defeat the main obstacle to my goal is...

components.name: Implementation Intention
components.text:
Now, for the full if-then plan. 

You said your main obstacle was "{Identify the Main Obstacle}". You also said that the action you could take to defeat it was "{Identify an Action}".

 We could stick those together for you, but it will help you better connect them in your mind if you do it. Using the same words or changing them to your liking, state your implementation intention in the form of "

If _______ occurs, then I will _______.

components.name: Imagine Your Implementation Intention
components.text:
You said that "{Implementation Intention}"

Take some time to really think about what this means. Imagine both the circumstances in which you might need to practice this and enacting the response you've prepared.
